events.message: The customer reported an auto accident involving their sedan in a parking lot, requesting to file a claim for damages sustained.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident based on the description mentioning vehicle collision and damage.
An insurance agent specialized in auto accident claims was assigned to assist the customer and manage the claim process efficiently.
The insurance provider officially acknowledged receipt of the claim, assuring the customer of timely support and updates.
Requested all relevant documents, including accident report, photos of the car damage, and driver’s license, to proceed with the investigation.
The customer promptly submitted the police report, photographs of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates as requested.
The investigation team began reviewing the submitted evidence and contacted the other party involved in the accident for further information.
Investigation was completed concluding that the insured customer was not at fault, confirming the accident details matched the claim.
A fair settlement offer was proposed covering all reasonable repair costs, rental car reimbursement, and related expenses.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the claim handling process and appreciated the quick response and clear communication.
The claim was officially approved by the claims department following customer acceptance of the proposed settlement terms.
Payment for the approved amount was issued directly to the customer's bank account to cover repair costs and associated expenses.
The claim was formally closed after payment issuance and confirmation that the customer’s vehicle repairs were underway.
The case was archived in the insurance system for future reference and auditing purposes, marking completion of all claim activities.
